text: grilling is probably the quickest method
for cooking fish but unfortunately a lot
of people are afraid to actually grill
their fish today I'm going to share with
you some tips and tricks for grilling
fish and you will have no fears to get
started here I want to explain a few
things about the actual types of fish
that are good for the grill needy pieces
of fish are really great
so swordfish is a great example also
tuna does really well on the grill
salmon or other oily fish really work
well on the grill as well
I have mahi-mahi here striped bass is
also another needy oily fish that really
does have enough structure to hold up on
the grill now if you wanted something
with a lighter flake to it a lighter
type of fish like trout you might want
to think about grilling it whole like
this because all of the bones and the
skin really help the fish to stay
together well today I'm going to grill
swordfish and salmon so I have a grill
pan since we're indoors here you could
certainly do this on your outdoor grill
you want to use high heat and direct
heat and what I'm going to do is oil the
grill itself I'm using safflower oil any
high heat neutral flavored oil so rub
the grates of your grill with oil it
will prevent the fish from sticking now
what I'm going to do is take a little
bit more oil and drizzle it over my fish
I always say this whenever you're
cooking fish whenever you're cooking
meat you don't want it to be too cold
right out of the refrigerator because
the outside of your fish will cook at a
faster rate than the inside because it's
so cold bringing out your fish or meat
from the refrigerator for a little bit
so it comes closer to room temperature
really will help your fish cook evenly
so I'm just using a little bit of oil
I'm going to season these guys up with a
liberal sprinkling of salt a little bit
of pepper
you can certainly use your favorite
spice blend here if you have one
now another general rule for grilling
fish is that you want to select pieces
from your fishmonger or your supermarket
that are at least a half an inch in
thickness that will really hold up well
on the grill so I have my hot hot grill
that's been oiled I have my pieces of
fish that have been oiled and seasoned
and now I'm going to place them directly
on the grill now do not move the fish
once you've put it on the grill let it
cook it needs to create a crust almost
on the outside which will free itself
then the flesh of the fish from the
grill pan if you mess around with it
right now what you're going to do is
you're gonna cause the fish to stick and
it's going to flake off and ultimately
damage your fish so a good good sear
this will probably take about three
minutes it depends on the heat of your
grill and then you're going to flip so
it's been about three to four minutes
and now I'm going to give the fish a
turn and it really shouldn't take that
much effort to do this so if you're
struggling if the fish isn't flipping
easily it's not done yet give it a
little bit more time this looks like
it's going to flip very nicely look at
that golden brown color those really
great grill marks another I would say
three to four minutes on this side let's
see if we can flip our swordfish here
beautiful and really it's all about not
agitating or moving the fish while it's
cooking let it do its thing so it's been
another three minutes here's a really
popular question how do you tell when
your fish is thoroughly cooked it's
really easy super simple take a thin
paring knife or you could use a metal
skewer and what you're gonna do is stick
it into the thickest part of the fish
for just a few seconds you're gonna pull
it out and tell by the temperature of
the tip of the knife whether or not the
fish is done it should be warm to the
touch if it's warm to the touch that
means that your fish is fully cooked in
the center if it's too cool you need to
continue cooking your fish this is warm
to the touch so it's done so I'm gonna
remove the salmon to a plate
remove the swordfish so there you go
grilling fish it's a lot simpler than
you think just remember those golden
rules those tips and tricks and you will
have success enjoy
